verbs.description: narcotize (third-person singular simple present narcotizes, present participle narcotizing, simple past and past participle narcotized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To use a narcotic in order to make (someone) drowsy or insensible; to anesthetize, to drug. [from 16th c.]
(transitive) To dull the senses of (a person, place etc.). [from 19th c.]
(transitive) To make into a narcotic. [from 19th c.]
examples: The sun hangs overhead like a lantern, the essence of new grass and apple blossom narcotizes the air, the clack and whir of the wheels have a quelling, hypnotic effect on the passengers.
